{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.20707v1", "title": "Cavity Field-Driven Symmetry Breaking and Modulation of Vibrational
  Properties: Insights from the Analytical QED-HF Hessian", "summary": "In this work, we present the analytical derivation and implementation of the
quantum electrodynamics Hartree-Fock Hessian. We investigate how electronic
strong coupling influences molecular vibrational properties, applying this
framework to formaldehyde, p-nitroaniline, and adamantane. Our analysis reveals
cavity-induced changes in vibrational frequencies and intensities.
Additionally, we show how the quantum electromagnetic field breaks molecular
symmetry, activating previously forbidden infrared transitions. Our findings
highlight the potential of strong coupling as a method for controlling and
modulating molecular vibrational properties.", "main_category": "physics.chem-ph", "categories": "physics.chem-ph", "published": "2025-04-29T12:38:21Z"}
